{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's history of spelunking in Mexico suggests a potential exposure to bats, which are known carriers of the rabies virus. The symptoms of agitation, photophobia, and dysphagia are also consistent with rabies. Rabies virus is known to spread to the CNS via retrograde migration up peripheral nerve axons after initial infection at the site of a bite or scratch. Therefore, the most likely method of spread to the CNS in this case would be retrograde migration up peripheral nerve axons.", "answer_choice": "B"}
